reviews.review_msg: This is such a useless course. Prof is passionate but doesn't seem to even understand the course or maybe its because its planned poorly. She doesn't reply, and class material doesn't really help prepare for the paper.

This was one of the most useless classes I've taken. This prof does one lecture in wk 2 for 4 hrs (4 min break only), and the rest of the semester consists of classmate presentations. 10 weeks, 4 presenters each week (40 students), each presenter about 45 minutes to an hour.  She doesn't need to lecture. You self-learn this class.
Very nice and helpful for your works.

The entire course is based on your classmates' presentations and yours (20mins long). She does not lecture or grade your paper. There is a marker who grades your paper. Don't expect she will teach you something. You have to read and learn by yourself and ask for help.
She is nicea and she will give a lot of help if you discuss course material with her.

Very little interest in the class. She did not even bother to update the Syllabus from the previous semester, leaving dates, deadlines and weeks as they were from the previous semester. After week 4 she stopped presenting all together and we just listened to students summarize the readings.

Honestly started out liking her in class but as the semester went buy she starts to take a toll on you, she snaps at you and will often publicly shame you in class for checking your phone or eating something in class. Her classes are reading intensive from anywhere around 40-50 pages each week she likes to again shame you for not being able to do.

Nawal totally wasted students time! She controlled everything and did not allow different opinions! She gave poor feedback and did not care about students!!! She has parochial ideas! She is the most ridiculous and strict marker in the history of SFU! So so bad!!!!!! 0/10!!! definitely!

Enthusiastic prof, great delivery in class. Engages students and provides a fun seminar experience. Assignments are very fair, and fairly marked. Learnt a lot about feminism in this class! I recommend it to anyone.
Awesome prof, knows her stuff on feminism, engages the class well, friendly, helpful, fair marker...would take a class with her again!
She's really nice but I thought the material could have been better focused.  Just seemed a bit broad.
Fionna was great, she listened to the classes concerns, was always there for help and really interesting to listen to. One of my favorite profs to date!

REALLY unapproachable and is very set on her own agenda, which discourages open conversation.  I know a lot of other students were intimidated out of participating in class because of her overly harsh manner.  I also don't feel like I learned anything in this class.  My marks were top but the experience was a fail!

I think Kate is an extremely intelligent woman with great interest in what she is teaching.  She can be a bit pessimistic and moody at times but that comes from her realistic approach on life.  Her feedback can be a bit rough, but it is honest and motivating.  Her grading is fair despite the comments.  She delivers the material very well.
